The Arizona State team, led by a coach who was also a former University of Arizona player, had a distinctive black cat mascot. This remark caught the attention of the local newspaper, who then used the phrase "Wildcats" to describe the team's aggressive play.

The nickname stuck, and the team adopted it officially in 1915. The University of Arizona's mascot, an anthropomorphic wildcat named Wilbur, made his debut in 1925.
